page.title: 16THE WHEATSHEAF AT WOODFORD
page.content: This public house has been going for many years. Many years ago it would have been only a brewery and the big barrels of beer would have been taken around the village and sold, but this was when there were few means of transport and then, when communication increased people were able to get to the brewery and it became a public house. The opening hours are from ten a.m. until 2.30 p.m. In the summer it re-opens at six thirty p.m. and closes at eleven p.m. but in winter it still opens at six thirty but closes at ten p.m. Many people used to go to the public house but now even more come, because of the great increase in tourism around Salisbury. Public houses can be very interesting. On the walls are pictures and badges of many years ago.
